Early Access Review

Holy ♥♥♥♥.

So I signed up for the closed beta, played it, did not enjoy it, and never played it again.

Now getting back on oh my goodness I AM BLOWN AWAY AT THE CHANGES

The main issues I had were the lag, the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ cluttered menu, the lack of an FoV slider, and the sluggish movement

The hit reg is SO ♥♥♥♥ING GOOD in this game. Honestly if you check my profile you see I play a lot of shooters. From Counter Strike to Call of Duty from Halo to Titanfall and Battlefield to all the smaller indie shooters I've played. It's remarkable

The menu is still a cluttered mess, so there's nothing much for me to say about that.

They added an FoV slider that goes to 105 but I feel like it should be a bit higher, plus the weapon viewmodel is still really high so it blocks a lot of the screen

The movement is kind of slow (You'll have to play to get a feel of it) but it's not too bad, and I think it fits the game.

Things I'd like to see are an better menu when you open the game. I mean it's really cluttered with ♥♥♥♥ everywhere, I was overwelmed when I first played it.

Anyways for only 5 bucks this game is for sure worth it.

Nexon claims that the current plan is to make it free to play with a microtransaction system.  Nexon also claims that they are developing this game with feedback from the community being of highest priority.  My feedback for Nexon is this:  Please, for the love of God, do NOT make this another pay-to-win game.  I'm okay with having a leveling system, earning credits and all that, but I don't want to have to shell out three times the cost of whatever the next Call of Duty will cost to just be adequate.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Like many others, I was hesistant to try this game out due to the rather mixed steam reviews of the game. But the need to check out new FPS games gave me the courage to do it. I jumped into the game with the Elite Early Access Pack and I am rather impressed. I fully understand the game is still in early access so I wasn't expecting much. What I saw was a really polished game with awesome graphics and animation.
Pro:
F2P on launch, Pay for skins only.
Good Graphics
Polished gameplay (did not experience crashes, stutters etc)
Like the characters, abilities and the gunplay (did not watch anime so I cannot say if the game missed anime potential)
Realistic Movements (running, switching weapons, recoil of the weapons, passing obstacles all have immersive animations and reasonable execution time)
Every match gives you random boost, unlockables for you to try
Con:
Player base isn't large possibily due to 5 dollar barrier to access, not sure about the game due to reviews etc

Overall, I really enjoy this game. I am glad I gave this game a chance and I hope those of you who read this review can give this game a chance. Have fun and I'll see you in game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At this moment and time in Early Access, GiTS:First Assault plays very similar to another free to play game (Tom Clancy: Ghosts) in structure and tactics. Team based shooter, class based abilities, and a well planned cash shop to enhance cosmetics (and experience/currency boosters).

As an all around player the game modes are fun and enticing as you first dive in, but can leave some players bored quickly. But as a fan of both the show and fps games, I find no lack of amusing references along side the somewhat balanced gameplay.

Stats do make a difference and as you gain currency, I encourage you to plan out what guns/attachments you believe you'd enjoy playing with before you can afford them. But as long as you play accurately and as a team, gun choice won't make or break the game as a whole for you.

Admittedly (as of the time of this writing) the hitboxes are a little broken and can leave one confused on wether or not their smg is really hitting more often at point blank than the assault rifle from 50 feet further away, but given due consideration for early access, I expect it to improve with time.

Overall I love the game for the based lore and expect great things from the vast potential the IP possesses, but in time I hope to see a co-op campaign along side the PvP it's currently strictly aiming for.

(I thought what I'd do was, I'd pretend I was one of those deaf-mutes ... Or should I?)

Update:

Would still recommend this game. Here's some pros and cons I found:

Pros:
- Weapon customization
- Operative customization (almost like perks in COD)
- Slots open for more weapons in the future
- Rare items available after matches such as exp 500%
- They weave the anime in here nicely. For example when you click on "dive in" or want to look at an operative's info/background
- Original voices from the series
- Low quality game so even a non-gaming computer can run it (my MSI Dominator can run it maxed out without the power cord in on balanced mode

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a fun, fast-paced team shooter with unique character skills and customizable loadouts. For fans of Stand Alone Complex, the characters are fully realized and voice-acted, which is very nice.

The game is not pay-to-win, but it is pay-to-progress faster. Take that as you will, although unlockable weapons lean more towards being sidegrades than superior choices.

The two objective-based game modes are intense and exhilarating as team members share their unique skills with eachother to gain an advantage over the enemy team. Optic camo on, shields up, thermal vision activated - this is awesome, and very rewarding.

Final words: The game is still in a beta of sorts, but it responsive, action-packed, and has a good gameplay loop that puts rewards within your grasp and does not feel too grindy. I recommend it, especially at the entry price of five dollars which is available at the time of this review.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ConsBland gameplay. Dated visuals, clumsy movement (the parkour especially), huge viewmodels. No borderless windowed mode, unskippable intro, forced tutorial where you can't change your settings?! Main menu looks a right mess, everything leads to the shop. Requires Nexon ID and uses their less than stellar DRM/anticheat platform; at least the game doesn't refuse to run this time. Feels like Dirty Bomb, except with way less variety.

ProsAt least the framerate was high? It's GITS? I dunno. If you're okay with Nexon, just play Dirty Bomb. reviewText:
Early Access Review

Would only recommend this if you're very into multiplayer shooters. I only played for one hour during the free weekend, but I don't think I'll be returning.

The shooting is competent, the node-capture mode and team deathmatch work well enough. There's guns, sights and stat bonuses to grind or pay for. Characters (classes) have activated abilities that allow for some diversity; there's cloaking, deploying turrets or drones, seeing enemies through walls, super speed, that kind of thing. 2 other teammates can use the ability you have active too, which is a neat idea. You spawn with a gun, a pistol, 1 grenade, and a knife that will one-hit-kill, so be ready to encounter the sprint+knife build.

For me, the thing that makes me not recommend it to most people is that it's just such a waste of a license. You've got a series built on political intrigue and musings on what human digitalization will mean for the world, punctuated with action scenes. How is a multiplayer FPS a good match for that at all? There's recognizable stuff from Ghost in the Shell all over the game, but it feels shoehorned into a game template. Teammates will look like Section 9 characters, but they're just skins with distinct activated abilities. When you capture a node, a tachikoma will show up to blast some enemies for a while, but you can't enter it and it's not very agile. It looks like a think-tank when it's on the opposing side, just as the enemy characters will look like generic baddies.
It's just meaningless shootybangs in a setting that is so much richer than this.

If you're into multiplayer FPS, there's nothing really wrong here, and there's a few cool twists. If you want a Ghost in the Shell game, look elsewhere, like the PS2 third person shooter Stand Alone Complex game (I guess the PSP FPS sequel is where it all started to go wrong).

Pros: Great voice acting, some iconic weapons, nice theme
Cons: Limited map rotation, maps are small, matches snowbally

It is not a bad game. Its not a good game either. If you are on the fence about this game stay there until the monetization model is made more clear.If Blacklight taught us anything about F2P FPSs it is a GREAT game can be ruined last minute by a P2W cash shop. With this game being published by Nexon, a company that is known for ruining its games with P2W mechanics, the idea of buying power, or shortcuts to power, will be a major concern.

Right now it is fairly balanced, but right now it is very early in Early Access, half the interface buttons do not work and the cash shop has yet to be populated. Until the cash shop is implemented, and we can see what they are selling this game is probably best avoided unless you are a hardcore GitS fan and want to hear more of the English voice actors, props on the devs for that much at least.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

GHOST IN THE SHELL ONLINE (ALPHA) : QUICK 10 MINUTES PLAYED REVIEW!!

So I picked up GITS:Online on steam, the £6 bundle with some free skins etc, base pack with the current discount is £3.99.

You get thrown into a training system mission without being able to set your screen resolution (But I'm sure they will let you sort that later when they change / update the game, I was able to set it after the training).

So you do a basic training system then you get thrown into a very simple menu system to select a basic character from the Anime Series, if you don't know the series, you can still enjoy this game / find it easy to use this menu as its basically just setting up weapons and mods for said munitions.

The graphics (On High 1920x1080) seem rather good, nice flow to the game, free feeling movement, I wonder where this game would really progress into being that its just literally PVP pew pew bang bang.

You currently cannot change the buttons for side mouse buttons, i.e. Reload as side 2 or Use as Side 1.

I played a single game of a capture style base push, enjoyed it, ranked up a load of kills and even got a double melee kill, it will be an enjoyable game but I can already see it being FTP/PTW possibly in the future.

Which is a sad thing really seeing how good the GITS series is, I really would have liked to have seen this being a single player game with an actual story and then having an online element to it.

Graphics - 8.7/10 (In Alpha but really good)
Game Play - 8/10 (Nothing special)
Sound - 8.5/10 (Attention grabbing)
Ease of use - 9/10
OVERALL - 8.5/10 (I can already forsee this being only popular with series fans and people whom think it just looks cool, again it will be FTP/PTW very quick.)

This is my view from the free weekend experience

Gunplay in this just doesn't feel right at all. As soon as you fire 2 or more shots from your assault rifle it flies out of control. Operator Licences you can unlock with ingame currency/NX points (real money). So it's pretty much the same business as to in Dirty Bomb (or some would cry DB is P2W and GitS isn't just baffles me)

So for me it's just another generic shooter with a GitS skin on top.

As a big fan of the anime series myself, I gave this a shot in CBT. None the less, I wasn't impressed.

Hit detection is god awful, hitboxes are god awful as well. The gameplay feels more akin to Blacklight Retribution than Call of Duty or Combat Arms.

So is this game decent? It's decent, like a five out of ten mediocre at best decent. It won't live up to the popular shooters like CSGO; and if you want to compare this to other F2P games because its free, it won't love up to ijji-era AvA.

I'd play this game more but they'll have to fix the glaring issues first.


This game, as a big fan of the entire series (Watched the entire damn thing), I feel like this game is not worthy of the Ghost in the Shell title.

I wouldn't reccomend it at the moment.  The guns are great and I enjoy the shooting but the gameplay is just: shoot stuff and get xp to unlock stuff. Im growing tiresome of multiplayer shoots where the main point is just unlocking stuff.  People aren't playing to have a good time with other people, they are grinding away at XP so they can max out and move onto the next game. I enjoy the unlocking, but all the depth in this game takes place on the main menu where you can customize every part of your weapon and your stats on your character. Im tired of 'building my solider.' I dont want to get the edge over my enemy by choosing something before I even get into the game.

I like the game, but I dont like how the main focus is going to be XP and character unlocks. The main focus needs to be robust gameplay.  Maybe Im the only one who feels this way.  If you really enjoy leveling up and grinding away at team deathmatch, this game is for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, for GITS fans it's not exactly what they wanted, an FPS. But, for what it has to offer, First Assault is an enjoyable game. People were afraid it would be P2W (pay-to-win) since it's being released by Nexon, a company well known for their implementation of micro-transactions. But as of right now, the weapons seem to be balanced and gameplay is fair. This could change in the future of course, but right now First Assault has proven to be a good online FPS. The gameplay might be reminiscent to that of Call of Duty, which may be a bad thing for some people, since it would be seen as generic, there are some differences however. First Assault tries to put more emphasis on teamwork in the demolition and terminal conquest modes, what I've also noticed is that there is no regenerative health unlike Call of Duty. Some have made the argument that it's a CoD reskin, but First Assault tries it's best to maintain the aspects of the GITS universe. Like I've said, this is an enjoyable game. My only gripes are that the textures seem a bit unpolished, and the maps are relatively small.

In conclusion, definitely give it a chance if you're considering. Since it's in early access currently, there's a small fee to get in ($4.99). However, sometime in early 2016 the game will be free to play, and would most likely be fixed of any technical bugs found with possibly some new content added.

It's definitely worth five bucks if you're interested right now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early access, so obviously there's some things in need of working out. That being said, I'm happy. I'm a hardcore GiTS fan and this game makes me smile when I start it up. The usage of the original english voice cast (except Crispin Freeman, unless I miss my mark) really got the fan boner going. Now for the good, the bad, and the ugly.

The Good:
-Fast paced game play.
-Decent weapon selection.
-Lots of character choices with a variety of abilities.
-Well designed maps for the most part.
-Tachikomas.


The Bad:
-The inability to fire a weapon full auto and maintain decent accuracy. (say what you will for realism, but I'd rather hit my targets)
-Attachment costs for weapons are just a tad exhorbitant.
-Spawnkilling is a major issue as there's no form of spawn protection or penalty for the other team being in your spawn.
-Placement of spawns in relation to objectives (I'm looking at you, Tachikoma Conquest).
- No Co-op or other PvE mode.
-Stealth seems to be pretty ineffective unless you're braindead.

The Ugly:
-Not enough Tachikoma.
-SMG and AK-47's dominate everything.
-Sniper is useless given current map selection (as well as toggle scope being the only option)
-Not enough Tachikoma.
-No method to regain health unless you or a teammate run nano-gel armor. Sucks to run around at 2hp with zero hope to make a comeback.
-Headshot damage seems to vary wildly (no idea how to explain that one).
-Not enough Tachikoma.

For all its flaws though, I'm a fan. Hope to see some improvements made where it counts.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

tl:dr - GITS: First Assault - SAC looks a lot similar to Tom Clancy’s Ghost Recon: Phantoms, just with Section 9, better graphics, different abilities and more story when you play it. This game has potential, I just hope that it attempts to avoid the P2W route like most F2P FPS games end up doing (aka VERY BADLY).

Pros:
+++ All the Section 9 characters are there! Even a Tachikoma (on KOTH mode), with original voice lines.
+ Influences team based play.
+ Easy to understand Tutorial
+ Most weapons are pretty balanced
+ Nice concept and Interface
+ Fast and clean when in combat
+ Leveling up rewards you with more goodies.

Cons:
- Very iffy matchmaking
- Auguments are ok... Its that they have a durability.
- Hit boxes
- Microtransactions
-

GITS: First Assault - SAC (Full Review)

I first got the Early Access to play something else besides CS:GO, with that I also wanted to help the Dev’s out with the game as a beta tester that could find game breaking glitches or issues. Yes, the weapons and items do not look like the ones directly from the anime/manga series. Please be aware that the devs are working (hopefully) on something that ties those weapons in.

When first launched I was automatically thrown into the tutorial level. The one thing that tutorial levels lack in the F2P category is the aggressiveness of the average player and how to combat that. This is good, but I believe that it should be tweaked to understand how the community would play the game (more aggressive) than how the dev’s would see us play the game.

Power Sync - Sharing your powers with everyone in your squad (doesn’t apply for Rocket Launch and Drones). Sharing is caring.

When entering my first multiplayer match, the set up is similar to most FPS games. These are the game current modes: TDM, S&D, KOTH. The one that stands out the most from all of these is KOTH, this version relays a direct award whenever you capture a point. You are rewarded with a Tachikoma/ThinkTank that fights for or against you.

Besides the modes, the game is indefinitely directed for you to be a team with your squad members, without them you’re good as dead each round.

I'd like to see this game go into the more leveling up route than the pay 2 win route, it entices players to keep playing and doesn't deter newer players from buying up.

The best thing about this so far is that you are forced to play to unlock certain weapons in the game (example OP shotgun), I like this idea the best because it prevents people from buying all of the weapons all at once.

Overall I would recommend this game because of its aspects and playstyles, it has good potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've come to this game as someone who is more a fan of Ghost in the Shell than modern FPS games so please bare this in mind.

1. Games Mechanics & Theme
2. Issues
3. Final Thoughts
-----------------------

1 Game Mechanics and Theme
The game goes above and beyond to make the gunfire feel realistic.  The animations are well beyond the level I would expect from a smaller Studio (E.g. a non-triple-A studio), the feel, hip-fire / aiming down sights and scoped all seem very complete.  The recoil is something you will hear a lot about this game, it's insane.  It favours a style of play that makes me think of Rainbow 6 meets TF2.  As you start to level you start to naturally form squad tactics because if you don't and run in guns blazing you can kiss your ♥♥♥ goodbye.  Any headshot will stop you in your tracks really, regardless of calabre. Squad tactics are also reinforced by a localised special ability buff that can be shared by a few of the playable characters.  These vary in usefulness - from a small speed boost with the ability to wall run / double jump to invisibility & shield armor.  The initial modes are well executed - my personal favourites being a nod to TF2 Payload, though bomb defusal is very enjoyable too, alongside standard deathmatch etc.  These all have a nod to the Stand Alone Complex series; in fact while waiting they show clips of the show - In my opinion they need to do more of this.

2 Issues
The recoil is going to be the thing that many folks will try and shaft this game with - but honestly thats a red herring.  The game has a COD style progression system that includes character upgrades that work with the theme of the title more so than any other game due to the cybernetic nature of the world universe and these upgrades will effect end game recoil with varying degree's of negative pay offs for doing so.  Honestly the recoil works how guns work.  You can spray and prey but someone who knows the game will shut you down so fast it's really not worth the bullets.  Best to work in groups and take the time to aim.

That aside - the game is Early Access - so content is somewhat lacking.  (I write this review as Open BETA early access has gone live 48 hours ago or less).  I'm actually writing this as the servers are down for bug fixing and content additions.

I also do not know how much they are planning to charge for character skins.

Honestly, the only real gripe I have is the time it takes to start a match.  Usually its around 40 seconds, which after playing for 10 hours straight seems like an eternity.

3 Final Thoughts
I imagine 'end game' being a very focused style of old era Tom Clancy style tactics.  It's a market that is in my eyes untapped outside of the aformentioned titles.  I strongly recommend for FPS fans and Ghost in the Shell fans alike.  If you want to have a match, my ingame name is Zhoutai :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before purchasing this, ask yourself 2 questions:

-Do you like GITS?
-Do you like Arena FPS'?

If you answered yes to both of these, get this. If not, you may want to hold off for it to be out of Early Access for when it goes FTP. Personally, I've been having a blast with the game. Despite its flaws, it's a fast paced, enjoyable shooter, and the people I've played with have been enjoyable company as opposed to the typical CS:GO crowd I deal with.

So if you want to play as Major and stealth shank people while they're trying to cap points, pick this up. Otherwise, wait.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Speaking as someone who sucks at FPS this game is pretty awesome! I really didn't expect anything from an Early Access game but after these few hours I just can't stop playing! I only stopped to write this review because the servers are going down for maintenance. It's clearly well polished and while there are some functionalities missing I don't think it will ruin the gameplay experience. The classes are well balanced, the syncing mechanic is also really nice and the gun play feels so good! The art is also fantastic, it's not mind blowingly awesome but it fits the theme and the characters in it well. As a fan of the anime I can;t wait to see the finished product.

Just as a side note: To anyone claiming this is a P2W game. I don't feel it. You need to level up your guns before you can even buy the enhancements and a lot of the enchancements has negative trade offs for each stat boosted. I've never played a match where I felt like I;ve been cheated because some schmup is using a better gun. A lot of times it's usually the guy who's using the knife who's wrecking everyone else. So as far as P2W? I don't think so. But maybe I'm not that far into the game yet to feel it's effects. If I do feel it I'll quickly change my review to a negative one.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you like GITS and more or less functional shooters then you'll love First Assault.
If Nexon scares you then you've got every reason to be afraid, however at least at the time of writing I can say that this game has by miracle dodged the typical Nexon monetization strategy".

Unlike most free-to-play Korean shooters the microtransactions are mostly fair. Once you buy an item you own it forever
date: furthermore in-game currency is at least for right now very generous. Match-to-match wont give you too much reward but every level-up rewards you with 50
recommended: 000 GP. Weapon prices are in the range of about 150
voteText: 000 gp
helpfulPercent: but by playing you can essentially unlock many weapons around ~20
votesHelpful:
000 gp.

Weapon balance is mostly acceptable. Nothing too obviously egregious. Most weapons will instantly kill a target with a headshot which currently gives SMGs too much power on DM. Additionally it appears (though I could be mistaken) that headshots are at least partially random.

Otherwise the gameplay feels pretty good and mostly rewards skilled players. There's not much ham either with bunny hopping being punished and grenade spam being used mostly for softening up targets rather than killing people. Server performance has been fairly stable and only a few instances of "laggy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t".

It's hard to say what the future for this game will be
votesTotal: if previous Nexon titles are any indication hackers and microtransaction hell might be right around the corner.\n\nBut for now
votesFunny: if you want an unsophisticated shooter to just mess about with some friends then you'll have a pretty decent time with First Assault. Hell
commentsCount: it's current state is more engaging and content-rich than Star Wars Battlefront at $60."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

alright so. i've been playing this game for a few  hours now on record, and now i think i'm ready to give my thoughts on this game. when i first heard about it, i was excited, i've always wanted a new ghost in the shell game since the ps2 game (which in all honesty is pretty mediocre, unless you're a fan of the series). and on day one i immediatley bought it.

Early access usually means that the game i chalked full of game breaking bugs and glitches, but in all honesty i've had no problem, the only time i ever had a problem was when i was changing the resolution settings and it crashed, and i was able to immediatley boot it back up with no problem (nothing a patch can't fix).

gameplay wise it's ver much like counter strike or any other MMOFPS, along with the leveling up and unlocking new guns and attatchments for whatever.

buth the one thing that stands out is the abilities and the sharing of abilities, i mean yeah, most MMOFPS's have classes with their own unique abilities, but i think that the ability to share those abilities amouing your teammates is so cool and something that blends well into the series.

but it if i did have to make a short list of cons.
-the spawns can be irritating sometimes
-No sign of playable Tachicomas (honestly i've been playing deathmatch, they could be in there in other gamemodes)
-and no campaign (if i'm gonna play ghost in the shell game, a story would make sense)

of course i am aware this is early access and it's not finished yet, but as of right now it is a solid online shooter that is tons of fun in my book. good work guys! keep it up!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A nexon shooter that isn't pay to win? It's balanced but i get a feeling that the moment the cash shop is introduced the game will become broken. Although they could just sell skins who knows. They got all the original voice actors and the sound and interface design makes the game feel like your playing an action sequence from ghost in the shell. At its core its still call of duty though with the main feature being that the character you select has a special ability that charges over time. Some are better than others but none fo them are bad. Togusa is the only one thats arguably op but i think it would be balanced with better hit detection. I think this is a fun ghost in the shell themed call of duty game but I can see it getting old 10 or 20 hours in when the weapon and character unlocks start slowing down.

I can't wait for nexon to ruin this game with a cash shop and force me to change this review. Or maybe they learned from all those other pay to win shooters that it just drives players away.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo far only 3 hours into the game and I think it's worth the $5.  As of now it's nothing over the top as far as fps, but they do their best to integrate elements from ghost in the shell.  The on main concern I have is of weapons doing damage when they please.  There's time I've lit up the back of an enemy and he'll turn around and 1-shot me.  I've heard that's because of lag compensation and if that's the case I hope they fix it in the near future.  Other than that I really have no other complaints.  Voice chat would of course be a nice touch to it, but tbh i think it can go without it if need be or at least have the option to not hear the other players if they do decide to implement that.  So far it's worth the money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've come to this game as someone who is more a fan of Ghost in the Shell than modern FPS games so please bare this in mind.

1. Games Mechanics & Theme
2. Issues
3. Final Thoughts
-----------------------

1 Game Mechanics and Theme
The game goes above and beyond to make the gunfire feel realistic.  The animations are well beyond the level I would expect from a smaller Studio (E.g. a non-triple-A studio), the feel, hip-fire / aiming down sights and scoped all seem very complete.  The recoil is something you will hear a lot about this game, it's insane.  It favours a style of play that makes me think of Rainbow 6 meets TF2.  As you start to level you start to naturally form squad tactics because if you don't and run in guns blazing you can kiss your ♥♥♥ goodbye.  Any headshot will stop you in your tracks really, regardless of calabre. Squad tactics are also reinforced by a localised special ability buff that can be shared by a few of the playable characters.  These vary in usefulness - from a small speed boost with the ability to wall run / double jump to invisibility & shield armor.  The initial modes are well executed - my personal favourites being a nod to TF2 Payload, though bomb defusal is very enjoyable too, alongside standard deathmatch etc.  These all have a nod to the Stand Alone Complex series; in fact while waiting they show clips of the show - In my opinion they need to do more of this.

2 Issues
The recoil is going to be the thing that many folks will try and shaft this game with - but honestly thats a red herring.  The game has a COD style progression system that includes character upgrades that work with the theme of the title more so than any other game due to the cybernetic nature of the world universe and these upgrades will effect end game recoil with varying degree's of negative pay offs for doing so.  Honestly the recoil works how guns work.  You can spray and prey but someone who knows the game will shut you down so fast it's really not worth the bullets.  Best to work in groups and take the time to aim.

That aside - the game is Early Access - so content is somewhat lacking.  (I write this review as Open BETA early access has gone live 48 hours ago or less).  I'm actually writing this as the servers are down for bug fixing and content additions.

I also do not know how much they are planning to charge for character skins.

Honestly, the only real gripe I have is the time it takes to start a match.  Usually its around 40 seconds, which after playing for 10 hours straight seems like an eternity.

3 Final Thoughts
I imagine 'end game' being a very focused style of old era Tom Clancy style tactics.  It's a market that is in my eyes untapped outside of the aformentioned titles.  I strongly recommend for FPS fans and Ghost in the Shell fans alike.  If you want to have a match, my ingame name is Zhoutai :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty fun, but so far it really feels a lot like black ops.
The Auto-balancing doesn't do anything, that I've seen. The teams stay the same every match, with the exception of someone leaving or joining. When joining a match, you get placed in the team with the lowest number of people. I'd prefer if they balanced the teams based on most recent K/D, with an option for disabling the auto-balance for more competative teams. But that's just me.
There isn't really that many people playing right now, so we'll see in time, but at the moment there's only one match for whatever gametype I select: terminal defense, team deathmatch, demolition, or random.

The sniper rifles are very difficult to use. Firing from the hip without attachments, I could probably land a hit 1/100th of the time at 5m. It's even more difficult to hit while moving, hip or aiming, but that may just be me.
Only one melee, with an assassination that's pretty hard to land unless the enemy's standing still.
There are two pistols, the basic well balanced, and the magnum. The magnum has poor distance 5m or less, but can headshot in one hit, and nearly kill in one hit anywhere else on the body.
One shotgun, that I've seen, but you have to unlock it.
Auto and semi-automatics are by far the greatest in number, with a decent range of variation.
With the exception of melee and pistols, all weapons have attachments that'll slightly alter the weapon's stats, at least 10 or more per weapon.
Also, you can pick up the primary weapon last equiped by downed enemies.

This game is more skill/perserverance/luck, money can only get you the early access packs, to my knowledge.
Overall, it still needs work but I recommend it anyway. P.S. Don't melee the Think Tank, I've seen it, the sad giblets flew everywhere.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tl;dr version:
Feels like a blend between Overwatch and Counter Strike/Call of Duty
Game's good.
Matchmaking and aiming issues that you get used to
Is hella fun with friends
Recommend buying if you have spare 5 bucks, or wait until it comes out and goes F2P


It has been a while since the last time I played a multiplayer FPS game and I was a bit hesitant to try this one out, however I'm glad I ended up trying it.
You know Counter Strike? What about Overwatch? Well this game sort of feels like a blend between Counter Strike and Overwatch with how the matches are pretty short with a very clear objective and how the character skills work.
Combine that with a very user-friendly HUD and delicious sound design, you get a pretty darn good game, especially if you consider this is an early access.
Althought the variety of weapons and characters that are given to you is not that massive but all the things you do get feel really polished and comfortable to use.

Of course there are a few glaring issues with this game, namely the matchmaking and bullet spread.
When you first start out you will most likely get placed into unfair matches where everyone is infinitely better than you but seeing how easy it is to get used to the game, in about an hour you won't feel the matchmaking issue.

Onto the big daddy of issues - the bullet spread. A lot of people seem to agree that it's really hard to understand how exactly the bullets fly from your gun but just like matchmaking you sort of get used to it.

Overall I could say that the game is pretty good and it obviously has a lot of love put into it, especially if you take Nexon's not-so-great reputation into account. A few issues that might turn a lot of people away are dominant but after some time they become unnoticable.

As a side note, if you have a friend force him to buy the game with you, it becomes infinitely more fun when both of you pick the guy with super sprint ability and go into the enemy backline shaking everyone.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

THIS A SOMEWHAT IN-DEPTH REVIEW AND OVERVIEW OF GHOST IN THE SHELL: STAND ALONE COMPLEX - FAO

TL;DR version - The game is a cut above the rest of the F2P shooters on steam, but It needs to work on its Ghost in The Shell Identity

Full Review

After playing this game for a bit I have to say, this game has the potential to be something great, honestly. The gun play is fast paced, which is why you'll see most people compare this game to Call of Duty, but it's more along the lines of Black Light: Retribution. Currently There are three modes, Team Deathmatch, Terminal Capture (Think Control Points from TF2, or King of the Hill), and Demolitions (Think Bomb Defuse from Counter-Strike). Team Deathmatch is probably the most popular mode, it's incredibly fast and a lot of times (atleast when I played) matches can come down to the wire with teams winning by only a couple kills. In Terminal Capture, Teams will have to capture... terminals in order to score points. When a terminal is captured, it also brings the Team's Walker Tank online to assist in battle, however it is sometimes hard to tell whether or not the Tank is helpful. Demolitions (My favorite game mode) pits two small teams against each other, one defending the targets and one trying to bomb them. In this game mode, there is no respawning, which makes the mode more nerve-racking, but also more enjoyable imo.

The Goods
As far as Free-to-play games go, this is one of the most well put together ones i've seen. You have to understand, there are A LOT of F2P shooter on Steam, and most of them suck ♥♥♥, so this game is a sight for sore eyes in this catagory. A lot of people complain about clunky movement" but I honestly don't know what they're talking about. Moving through the game is pretty smooth

Early Access Review

It's ok for a earily access, I personally think it needs a lot of work to be done in it. Clever use of skill syncing with your team mates, and you can feel it turning the tides of battle if you have a team that knows what to do.

The guns feel pretty loose, and even though I have bought the Elite Pack and own a tricked out rifle, and soon to have .50 cal. Sniper. I find myself going back to the M4A1 (The free gun) which is not a bad thing. Those who have incredible levels in CoD and have preistiged up high, or any BF 2-4 on rush type maps, know how important hip firing is. As I spectate a majority of players ADS even in point blank, then die with against a knife BF Style. Some of the pay guns spray horribly hip, or ADS. The M4A1 seems a bit more forgiving though it lacks fire power. Go into this game with a open mind, because theres a lot to work on.

Also

Ping > then Everyone

Even though the game is really fun, I cannot see myself getting really competive in it. The game does not have the crisp feel like its other competitors, example, Titan Fall, COD, BF Series.

Early Access Review

Before purchasing this, ask yourself 2 questions:

-Do you like GITS?
-Do you like Arena FPS'?

If you answered yes to both of these, get this. If not, you may want to hold off for it to be out of Early Access for when it goes FTP. Personally, I've been having a blast with the game. Despite its flaws, it's a fast paced, enjoyable shooter, and the people I've played with have been enjoyable company as opposed to the typical CS:GO crowd I deal with.

So if you want to play as Major and stealth shank people while they're trying to cap points, pick this up. Otherwise, wait.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Speaking as someone who sucks at FPS this game is pretty awesome! I really didn't expect anything from an Early Access game but after these few hours I just can't stop playing! I only stopped to write this review because the servers are going down for maintenance. It's clearly well polished and while there are some functionalities missing I don't think it will ruin the gameplay experience. The classes are well balanced, the syncing mechanic is also really nice and the gun play feels so good! The art is also fantastic, it's not mind blowingly awesome but it fits the theme and the characters in it well. As a fan of the anime I can;t wait to see the finished product.

Just as a side note: To anyone claiming this is a P2W game. I don't feel it. You need to level up your guns before you can even buy the enhancements and a lot of the enchancements has negative trade offs for each stat boosted. I've never played a match where I felt like I;ve been cheated because some schmup is using a better gun. A lot of times it's usually the guy who's using the knife who's wrecking everyone else. So as far as P2W? I don't think so. But maybe I'm not that far into the game yet to feel it's effects. If I do feel it I'll quickly change my review to a negative one.

Weapon balance is mostly acceptable. Nothing too obviously egregious. Most weapons will instantly kill a target with a headshot which currently gives SMGs too much power on DM. Additionally it appears (though I could be mistaken) that headshots are at least partially random.

Otherwise the gameplay feels pretty good and mostly rewards skilled players. There's not much ham either with bunny hopping being punished and grenade spam being used mostly for softening up targets rather than killing people. Server performance has been fairly stable and only a few instances of "laggy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t".

It's hard to say what the future for this game will be

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't even know what the anime is about, but the reason I bought this game was just to find a new FPS to get into and this game may be it! It has gameplay akin to CoD, but is different from that game in many ways. The game's speed is a mix of Medal of Honor Warfighter and Combat Arms, which makes for an interesting take on futuristic warfare when agetns take on terrorists in a good ol' fashioned fight to the death.

As of now, there are a considerable amount of weapons, but most of them are assault rifles and one of the weapons is not even an assault rifle; that being the M4A1. But, that's just being picky. To be honest, there needs to be more pistols, more SMGs, more shotguns (even though they are very OP), more MGs, etc. There needs to be more weapons to this game mainly because this game has the potential to give players many options in firepower.

The characters all have different abilities that can be used efficiently in battle. I stuck with the stealth character mainly because a lot of players tend to pick her and it comes in handy when you have the ability to share it with a your Tier 2 ability.

The game modes are fun, but there are only three to speak of at the moment. They are fun to keep you locked in and, for the Early Access, there is no Pay-to-Win currency. You know what that means? Yup, no Pay-to-Win weapons yet. If I were you, I would pick it up now while you still can before its F2P release hits the Steam store. It really pays off in the end and you can really suit yourself up if you are interested in the game enough.

It's fun, frantic and requires some skill, speed and coordination. Think of it as Counter-Strike on drugs with gameplay elements from Halo, Combat Arms, Medal of Honor Warfighter and other modern FPS games. If you hate Call of Duty, you can still get into this game. Honestly, you can.

Pick it up before it becomes F2P. Starting now is key for the game to avoid the Pay-to-Win approach and, with enough input, this game can become a better model for F2P FPS games in the future. What are you waiting? Pick up the damn game! ;)

9/10!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo far only 3 hours into the game and I think it's worth the $5.  As of now it's nothing over the top as far as fps, but they do their best to integrate elements from ghost in the shell.  The on main concern I have is of weapons doing damage when they please.  There's time I've lit up the back of an enemy and he'll turn around and 1-shot me.  I've heard that's because of lag compensation and if that's the case I hope they fix it in the near future.  Other than that I really have no other complaints.  Voice chat would of course be a nice touch to it, but tbh i think it can go without it if need be or at least have the option to not hear the other players if they do decide to implement that.  So far it's worth the money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Having put a relatively small 1.6 hours into this game, I have to say, I'm quite enjoying it. It's a modern shooter with a more classic feel.

The gameplay is strictly multiplayer, which hopefully they will update with a campaign of sorts, or a horde mode style mode at least.

The guns feel powerful. Never has a pistol in a standard FPS felt as heavy as a pistol would in real life. Granted, it doesn't do the damage of the rifles and SMGs, but it is a valid option if you run dry. That being said, all the guns feel heavy, as they should. I get tired in games that gear towards realism, when a heavy sniper rifle feels like it has the kick of a .22 calibur target rifle. This game breaks that, the SMG that you start with, feels powerful even.

Now that I've gotten my gungasm out of the way, let's move to actual gameplay. You pick the Section 9 Operative that you prefer, all of which having different abilities, the always beautiful Motoko having her token Thermo-Optic Camo, and Batou having his arm cannon, so on and so forth. That being said, Motoko is the main character, and a great protagonist at that, in the source, so you'll be seeing plenty of her. I myself picked Motoko straight away. However, you do get an Operative Unlock every level, so you'll have plenty of chances to try out the rest of the group.
The gameplay itself feels like a mix between a standard arena shooter, and the small group strategy of counter-strike. It brings incredibly fast gunplay, with no over the top abilities like jump-jets, or dodging. ADS is on point, and all of the standard sights work just fine for what they're meant for.

I for one, am very happy for my support and patronage for this game, and I expect to see more to come out of it. Try it out for yourself, and like me, you may be surprised in a good way. Highly recommended.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is actually a really good FPS that is in early access. I have messed around with most classes and put a few hours into the game so i feel that I can write this review. The maps are fun and interesting. There was only one map (that I can think of but i can't remember the name) that has balance issues. Also the spraying needs to be lowered a bit. I honestly rarely use my sights and just spray all the time and i get 10+ headshot kills. Other than that, it runs smoothly, its close to the anime as they could, graphics are well done with no issues with controls. The syncing of abilities deffinitely are useful and contribute to strategic side of the game. Not a lot of weapon choices or map choices right now. Hopefully this changes over time.  I would rate this 7/10 only because there are a few bug issues in the game, but overall i highly recomend this game as a FPS to kill time or if you enjoy COD (i personally dont but I still like this game).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very good for an Early Access game.

Pros:
+Guns feel solid
+Balanced recoil mechanics and bullet range
+Skills are balanced and don't instantly make you a god when you use them
+Skillsync is an interesting and useful game mechanic
+Well optimized for an Early Acess game. unlike some others *cough*DayZ*cough*
+Guns actually require you to get used to them, you can't just pick up a gun right off the bat and go wreck the opposing team
+Good voice acting
+Pretty good graphics, nothing too special though
+Good community from my experience (might change in the future though)
+Fun gamemodes

Cons:
-Not that many weapons (Still a good amount for an Early Access game)
-Relative lack of maps at the moment
-Auto-Balance could use some serious work

For $5, you really can't go wrong. The game is extremely good for an Early Access game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nNeeds to be tweaked and optimized a bit more, but otherwise a fun game. Even on the lowest settings, it still chokes and has occasional FPS drops if there is a lot going on. I'm strictly speaking for people with lower end PCs. Otherwise, for the most part my FPS is very solid. Mindless run and gun arcade like FPS. Great graphics. Easily worth $5. Just keep in mind: NEXON owns this game and it's still early access. For now, I'm very satisfied but it definitely needs (and will most likely receive) more content.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There is just so much to say about this game even after only having played under 10 hours of it so lets get to it.

I think this game is really amazing not only because it delivers the classic fps feel but because it adds some really cool stuff to the mix of a classic fps. The abilities in this game (other than it being freaking ghost in the shell) are what give this game such an amazing feeling in game. I mean you get to launch rockets from ur arm, turn invisible on the go, sprint like sanic himself, give urself a second layer of armor that also actively heals you, see where the enemy is with heat vision, deploy sentry turrets that defend an area or  enemy seeking drones that explode when they find someone, and thats not even all yet since the dev team said theyd be adding more to the game as it goes in terms of abilities, maps, guns, characters, etc. Not to mention that u can actively share some of those abilities with ur entire team! Anyway my point is that this game right now has a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of kick ♥♥♥ stuff waiting for u to get ur grubby little hands on it..... and for 5 FREAKING DOLLARS AT THAT. take the plunge, wait for opimization fixes for more polish, whatever. this game will be amazing if nexon doesnt ♥♥♥♥ it up. enjoy it while you can, i know i am!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being a big ghost in the shell fan I was really anticipating this game. And since I’ve played it, I found that it was really fun. Currently the game is a standard indie FPS but with some cool features. You can make your own classes and customize weapons (as to be expected). But the thing that makes this game different for any other is the skills
When you first log in you will be asked to recruit at character from the list (these are characters from ghost in the shell). Each character has a different skill such as heat sensors or optic camo as seen through out the ghost in the shell manga and anime. I know some people will be saying that they copied this from black ops 3, and I see where you’re coming from. But the one thing that makes this different is the idea of skill syncing. If you make your ability tier 2 you can share your ability with the people around you there for giving your team an advantage. But to get to tier to means that you have to get twice the amount of kills.
Would I recommend this game?
If you are a big fan and are thinking about playing it and you will play it in the future, then yes. The early access packages will give you an advantage in the future.
If you are looking for a cheap game that you will play for 2 weeks and never play again, then no. since the game is early access it is still quite bare and has limited maps, 3 game modes and a very limited variety of guns and attachments.
Over all when this game comes out in beta I would highly recommend this game to everybody I know who likes fps games. The Ghost in the shell series has always been famous and this is a very nice edition and with the up and coming live action movie I believe this game will be very popular.
Thanks for reading ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nGitS: SAC - First Assault does well in going into the multiplayer focused FPS genre and introducing some pretty neat elements. The system they have in place with characters possessing unique abilities as well as being able to share these abilities amongst your team definitely adds in changing up what could've been just another multiplayer FPS with a familiar title slapped on it. The only flaw I would say is rather prevelent is the pace at which the game performs. It handles a lot like Quake or Counter-Strike back in the day. Character models are moving very quick, it's pretty tough to get a bead on players, especially if you like running precision weapons. And the one hit-melee kill (you heard that right) seems to reward players for abandoning the tactical approach and just running in and trying to cause as much damage as possible. There are times when this game does perform very well, though, and that's why I'm recommending it. It harkens back to an older style of FPS that'll certainly weed out less experienced players, and will allow for more trial by fire" style progression. Give it a looksie

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me start this review by stating a few facts about my gameplay styles so you can get an Idea where Im coming from and who should read this review. I love first person shooters and they are the most of the games I own, although I have watched this anime I am not a big fan of anime (espeiclly narto and other S*** like that) and although i have played CoD in the past, and being a battlefield fan, the most I have played recently has been Milsim games with a cassual Milsim group (like Arma 3 with Alive/ACE mods). So if your like me and your wanting to buy this game because your freind wants you to, and you play games like me, then read on, for all the other anime fans and weebs out there, you should probbly go somewhere else.

If you want it short, yes this games is worth $5 and the only thing that makes it related to the anime are the charecters and thier abilities. If you want more details keep going.

Summery
This is strictly multiplayer, there is no story or offine mode, but thats expected with a $5 alpha game. In the begining you get to pick one charecter intill you get to level 5, but besides thier ability, they all play the same and they all have the same stuff. This is an extermlly close-qaurters game with guns and hit boxes that actually work so no BS on op guns or hits, but because it's all close qauters it plays like CoD (90% of the time whoever shoots first wins, but thats just how life works). Playing taticaly in this game is almost Impossible but you dont have to play like everyone else, it may not be the best but it stops you from dieing every two secends. Overal this game is pretty sound, if you have good internet it runs stable and looks good even on low graphics.

Pros
Good Grahpics (cant even tell your playing an anime game intill you the Major's ♥♥♥♥, which dosnt happen often.)
Low requirments
Stable
Not pay to win
Good Damage modles
Good hit boxes
Not hard to level up or get new equitment
No mics so no hot micers
Overall decent gameplay
Things you would expect from $40+ games

Not so bad cons
not to many maps
few weapons
repitive gamplay
unrealstic gun spec modles (M4 has 35 mters of range! What the hell!)
Some abilities are beeter than others
There is payable content, but it's aparentlly not expensive or that much beeter than the standerd equitment.

Besides from some bug fixes here and there (like the sniper rifle not shooting people and the nexon lancher not being compatible with the new windows 10 update [as of 12/29/15]) and some needed content this game this is really fun, even if your not a weeb!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is very fun. Its Counter Strike style combat but with unique abilities and styles of gameplay that make it more accessible to have fun in. Upside is that you can easily hop in and out of matches and have a good time. It doesn't take long for most games to finish so this game requires no commitment from you as far as time goes. Gameplay is smooth and easy to learn but difficult enough to keep you learning as you play. Abilities are important, and can be shared and a good ability share can change the game immensely. Loads of fun to play with friends.

Downside? Matchmaking is completely random. Yesterday I got paired with a fairly skilled team on each side. It was a blast to play, sometimes I died and sometimes I killed but overall it was challenging. Few minutes ago I got paired with MLG guys who were streaming the gameplay. Totally killed the game because they were curbstomping people. A bunch of people left, myself included, to play another time when they weren't on.

So if you are an somewhat average to high skill FPS player, this game will be fun most times. If you are anything less than that you'll probably die a lot and want to smash your keyboard. Especially if some twitch guys join your game. I only reccommend this game for people serious about the FPS genre and multiplayer in general. There's not a lot of Ghost In The Shell lore in this game, so if you are a fan of the anime you won't miss much by skipping this.

Overall though, not a bad game. We'll see how it further develops.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Important Points:
-It's in BETA
-Overall Generic Fps with some unique aspects
-Skill sync (Allows you to use a skill and share it with up to three of your teammates. It can stack from other players's skill syncs)
-The ability to play as a character from Ghost in the shell (Even though its a generic/basic version of him/her.)
-Not pay 2 win (Yet)
-Hit registry Blows more then a toothless hoe (It's getting better...slowly)
-Decent amount of gun customizations (mostly generic ones but still better then nothing)
-Laser sight... is just.. awful. It's not even a real laser sight it adds accuracy" doesn't display a dot..
-Small map selection at the moment all are decently sized.. not very big but not every small
-The game itself seems a little stiff in movement
-Currently no coop just a few PvP based modes (Possibly coop will be added in the future not sure)

My Rating: 6.9/10 (In it's current state)




Medium-ish Review:
First Assault is a generic multiplayer first person shooter with the appearence of Ghost in the shell... Is it good or bad? It's neither. It's a game that is good at not accomplishing much. Would I recomend it to a friend? Possibly. It's not terrible
date: It has decent gun choice and a non pay to win way to get guns (You earn them by playing). You can play as... basically generic versions of characters from the anime which isn't to bad but not to great. They introduced an interesting skill sync system in which once you get a certain amount of points you can active your ability and share it with up to 3 other players on your team (Plus you can stack with other skill syncs). That right there is the best thing about this game that it has the elements to incorprate team play but overall suffers from the terrible hit registry (Which is slowly getting better as they update the game). If you are unsure about the game I'd suggest to wait until it hits free to play but if you want to support the devs in help shaping the future of the game then get the game."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Long Story For a free-2-play (soon-to-be) game its pretty decent...Game has nice theme and really good feel to it. Players can choose starting hero with his own abilities and later they can change them as they wish (Only if you buy them but you will get free hero of your choice at lvl. 3 and lvl 5 of your account). There isnt much about the weapons...because there is just few of them (but its just Early Access so its ok). You can choose from variety of weapons like assault rifles, shotguns, smgs, sniper rifles etc. and modify them..The modification part isnt as good as in other sci-fi shooters like Blacklight but it has its own charm to it....You either buy mods for ridicilous price!!! (weapons bought from market) or you will buy them cheap but you have to unlock them first (weapons you get from start or those which you unlock by playing). All weapons and mods can be bought with currency you earn by playing...And i like that...The paid currency is for skins...nuff said...devs gotta eat too you know? >.< Now lets talk about game modes...there are 3 atm (4 if you count random) Terminal conquest (Capture the Point) Demolition (Competitive mode....you will know what im talkin about) and TDM. All of them are pretty good and i have no complains on them...But...lets be serious now...and HERE COMES MY COMPLAINS....So lets start with the worst things this game has...Spike lags...Whenever you are in face-to-face situation and you start shootin at each other...the game has tendency to lag for a fracture of second....After the lag...you are either dead or alive....Its happens so often that it will drive you crazy....The other problem of this game (for me) is the server instability...The server can randomly lag, disconnect you or either make the game unplayable....luckily i found this to happen only on EU servers....mostly on West one (thats why i play on American server...it works gud)...And the last of my complains (FINALLY ITS COMING TO AN END!!) is the hitboxes....now...this is kinda difficult to explain...it feels like it changes with every enemy you encouter...heck if i killed someone I DONT EVEN KNOW HOW I DID IT....sometimes you gotta shoot in front of them...sometimes slighty under head...and sometimes behind them....i just...dont know....But overall....I like this game...even if it drives me crazy sometimes...its good...I would rate it 7/10...just because its early access....


Short Story : Pros :
- Good theme (Legendary sci-fi anime)
- Good graphics
- Not pay-2-win
- No chinese rent-a-gun system nor repair system
- Playable (if you ignore spike lags)

Cons :
- SPIKE LAGS!!! God dammit i hate em..
- EU West is pretty unstable (Didnt played on East so much so i dunno)

My personal rating 7/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe original Ghost in the Shell film from 1995 is my all time favorite animated feture ever. The way it questions what makes a human human, the detail in the characters, the wat the CGI melds with the traditional animation, it all blew my mind the first time I saw it. That being said, I did not have high hopes that this game (or any game for that matter) would be able to adapt an anime as smart and philosophical as Ghost in the Shell into a team based online multiplayer first person shooter, and in a way I was right. Instead of trying to find a way to fit a story worthy of the GitS name into a game that is, at its core, just another online fps, it focused on the action aspects of the series, specifically the TV series Stand Alone Complex. And while that was disappointing to me as a fan of the franchise, I do enjoy the game, quite a bit. Despite the issues I have with the concept of the game, it feels good as an FPS, and the inclusion of the original voice actors from the English dub of SAC was a brilliant choice, as it give the game that much more relation to the series which, in my honest opinion, it needed. The models for the characters depict them better than I had hoped (as I said though, I had a low bar), Kusanagi looks as sexy, badass, and respectable as she should. The game isn't the best F2P shooter out there, but it is definitely worth checking out despite the lack of story which I should mention I forgive somewhat as it IS a team based online FPS, so plot is not exactly important. But I would of liked maybe some solo missions like the manditory tutorial when you first boot up the game (I couldn't even change the display size). Over all it is fun, and has a lot of little bits of fan service here and there. 6.9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very good for an Early Access game.

Pros:
+Guns feel solid
+Balanced recoil mechanics and bullet range
+Skills are balanced and don't instantly make you a god when you use them
+Skillsync is an interesting and useful game mechanic
+Well optimized for an Early Acess game. unlike some others *cough*DayZ*cough*
+Guns actually require you to get used to them, you can't just pick up a gun right off the bat and go wreck the opposing team
+Good voice acting
+Pretty good graphics, nothing too special though
+Good community from my experience (might change in the future though)
+Fun gamemodes

Cons:
-Not that many weapons (Still a good amount for an Early Access game)
-Relative lack of maps at the moment
-Auto-Balance could use some serious work

For $5, you really can't go wrong. The game is extremely good for an Early Access game.

There is just so much to say about this game even after only having played under 10 hours of it so lets get to it.

I think this game is really amazing not only because it delivers the classic fps feel but because it adds some really cool stuff to the mix of a classic fps. The abilities in this game (other than it being freaking ghost in the shell) are what give this game such an amazing feeling in game. I mean you get to launch rockets from ur arm, turn invisible on the go, sprint like sanic himself, give urself a second layer of armor that also actively heals you, see where the enemy is with heat vision, deploy sentry turrets that defend an area or  enemy seeking drones that explode when they find someone, and thats not even all yet since the dev team said theyd be adding more to the game as it goes in terms of abilities, maps, guns, characters, etc. Not to mention that u can actively share some of those abilities with ur entire team! Anyway my point is that this game right now has a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of kick ♥♥♥ stuff waiting for u to get ur grubby little hands on it..... and for 5 FREAKING DOLLARS AT THAT. take the plunge, wait for opimization fixes for more polish, whatever. this game will be amazing if nexon doesnt ♥♥♥♥ it up. enjoy it while you can, i know i am!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok first things first, I recommend using Bato when you first start off because his Rocket Arm allows you to use the splash dmg mechanic to your advantage and thus gain kills easily for cash and exp. Then you can get another (the actual one you wanted ) operative that you want to have fun with. Now for my actual review

Pros:
>The abilities are very useful for most situations
>Gun customization that is similar to ghost recon future soldier (has cons and I will talk about them)
>The tutorial is actualy not mandatory
>Gaining cash is not tough (but that is only when you win ofc)
>Weapons so far have no actual p2w system and relies solely on in-game currency
>Combat is fast paced, Headshots are insta-kill, I would consider it on par with games like CS but it does require you to aim
>sensitivity can be changed on the fly with [ or ]
>Knifing is insanely fun
>Voice work is great, they use scenes from anime to show game modes, which is very creative
>no friendly fire
>even though maps are pretty small snipers are still effective, esp with cloak
>ablities have a cooldown and cooldown can be shortened with kills or augmentation chips (what i would call them)
>shooting range to test your new toy
> attachments for guns cvan either be bought or earned through a unlocking system
> weapons included in game are: AR, SMG, LMG, Sniper Rifle, Secondary (pistol), and Melee
>So far no hackers, just met players that are skilled
> Skills are allowed to be shared amongst team members, ex: I activate tier 2 cloak then an ally who is using sprint ability activates tier 2 sprint, now whole team is able to use sprint and cloak if they press E to the people using Tier 2 abilities. This does not work with abilities such as turret or RPG arm.
>NO RENTAL SYSTEM
> Random Prize selection after games no matter if you lose or win
That is all the pro's that I can think of for now

Cons:
> Ishikawa's turrets are alright, I personally think they are weak and take too long to start up. My experience with the turrets in the game mode terminal conquest is that the turrets are useless on alot of the maps.
> The Bato RPG arm has a possibility to be spammed by players and prevent actual teamwork
> Weapons have limited amount of attachments as of right now
> Knifing animation prevents anyone from killing/canceling the attacker ex: If i knife a player then his friend cannot kill me by the time I have stabbed him
> Knifing allows for an easy way to kill players 100% as long as the knifing prompt appears
> Spawn kill exists and cannot be prevented so far
> the Big Machines are a pain in the ♥♥♥ to destroy once spawned during Terminal Conquest (I never finished the tut so I dont know how to kill them once they are downed)
> 1-10 sec Spawn Timer (I dont really care about the timer since it allows me to try and chat with players) allows enemies to advance on objectives if large amount of team is dead
> Sometimes players dont know how to play objectively
> Empty lobbies take forever to fill up and the only actual games with people in at the RANDOM section of QUICKPLAY
All that I can think of so far

Ok now people probably wonder what do they get if they get the Operative Pack? Well dont worry, all it gives players is an orange skin for the m4a1 and the mp5 along with 100k cash bonus. Note that a single attachment costs around 50k so the 100k is no big deal. I would say spend the money to just get the Recruit pack and then shoot people with rpg arm with mp5 in other hand until you are able to afford other attachments for other guns. For example, I use the mp5 since it kills enemies quick in CQB and then I got attachments for my m4a1 and now its beautiful.

Overall I enjoy the game and I plan on playing it alot since I have been trying to look for a fun sci-fi FPS game lately. I have played fast paced FPS games before but I do prefer teamwork so this game is a pretty efficient mix to my liking, but I think some mechanics need to be worked on such as maybe allow players to traverse environment a bit easier, I mean the characters are augmented and work on the turrets awareness and stopping power. Also explain how to destroy the big machine in the tutorial since all it says is Destroy the machine!". So far anything that requires real cash is going to be only cosmetic so far that is no big issue at all in my opinion.
"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Of course the Ghost in the Shell series deserves a more intricate game rather than a generic FPS, however, I think many negative reviews highly stress this fact alone and tend to overlook other elements in the game. Overall, it's actually a very enjoyable game at the moment, and at $5 for early access, it's definitely worth a try.

Other than the characters and the somewhat of the map stylization, don’t expect this game to have much relation with the Ghost in the Shell series.
Overlooking this point, it is a well-made FPS. The graphics are good, but not stellar. The gameplay is rough around the corners but perfectly reasonable and playable.
What separates this game from other generic FPS titles is the Skill Sync" ability. These abilities are unique to each character
date: and are fun to use with team mates in game.\n\nThere are complaints about bullet spread causing unintentional headshots or random respawns in enemy territory. I have experienced both
recommended: but honestly it is not a game breaking aspect
hoursPlayed: it really didn't bother me as a casual gamer.\n\nAlthough owned by Nexon
voteText: the in-game currency and market is quite fair. Leveling up will earn you enough to buy a few attachments and good unlockable weapons.\nHowever
helpfulPercent:
I am unsure of how this will change once it is released as F2P.

Pros:
- Surprisingly fun and easy to play
- Casual and quick pace
- Fair unlockable weapons market (For now)
- Skill Sync abilities makes game feel more unique
- Generally good quality game
- Voice actors from the actual series
- Short respawn timers

Cons:
- Generic weapons
- Small online population makes finding matches sometimes difficult
- matchmaking isn't always fair
- Does not relate to anime/movies at all.
- Very limited number of maps
- Bullet spread could need more work

TL;DR
7/10 for the game in its current state (if you can overlook Ghost in the Shell mask this FPS hides behind)
The game has a fair share of both pros and cons. I usually never play FPS games

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I like it. I got this game on the Winter Sale going on. I used to be really into one of Nexons other games, Combat Arms, which was eventually riddled with hackers. So you can take a wild guess as to why I was hesitant to purchase this. But, after watching several gameplay vids online I was sold.

After playing for a few hours I must say that this game has a ton of potential. It is very fast paced and the graphics are nice to look at. Some downsides are typical, especially when a game is basically in Alpha stage... For instance, bullet registry sometimes drops instantly and you find yourself firing blanks into an enemy. That issue tends to go away once you get used to tap firing. Also, there is some weird bug that leaves you wondering around like a ghost after you have been killed. You can still fire your weapons and attack players but they take no damage and you can't do anything that changes the outcome of the match. Another thing  since the game is in such an early stage the server options are very limited and sometimes you find that you are stuck with joining 1 or 2 rooms. I'm sure once the game grows that number will change.

I still enjoyed my few hours of being a flat out noob, although I did get a bit frustrated with bullets not registering and getting me killed at times. But, all-in-all this will be a game I pay attention to for quite a bit. I hope it grows into something big because it could be a fun, competitive game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex - First Assault Online is an arcade style shooter that is reminiscent of the long-gone style of Call of Duty. It's an extremely quick paced first person shooter that is sure to satisfy fans of the genre.

GitS:SAC - FA currently is in early access and is incredibly polished for a game so early in development. It has a small variety of guns but the ones currently included drastically change the gameplay. For example, the gun you're given, the M4A, is an assault rifle with decent mobility and decent fire rate. It has an odd spread but is great for mid to long range exchanges. The AK47, which can be unlocked after a few games of playing, has just about the same mobility but terrible fire rate, though it is justified with its insane damage and range; it's a guaranteed one-shot kill to the head and very hard to challenge from all ranges. Although it's only one example, the guns that are currently included in their respective category are all like this; they have a situation in which they excel in.

As much as this can remind people of CoD, it's far more team driven. One person can make a huge change in the game but will not be able to win the game by themself, due to the lack of any game-changing kill streaks. Scoring kills and playing the objective grant you ability points. Ability points are then used to activate your characters' special skill, which vary from character to the character. Each skill is unique and is, again, very situational. The great thing about this special skill mechanic is that some of these can be shared to the team; it is called Skill Link.

There are many noticeable bugs in the game, but that's going to happen with a game so early in development. There's the occasional player clipping in objects and some of the game mechanics not behaving properly, but all-in-all, it's still playable.

TL;DR: I recommend getting early access if you're slightly interested in this game or the GitS universe. I recommend you check the game out when it is released, as it's going to be free to play.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There are plenty of reviews on here that would essentially re-iterate what I would say were I to put the time into writing my full thoughts out thus I shall keep this concise.

As a gigantic Ghost in the Shell fan who even watched the Arise series, a game with the title was always going to be on my radar the second it popped up on Steam.

Having played it from Early Access launch, the game as-is is not particularly big. That's to be expected. There are a handful of maps, a handful of weapons and a couple of game modes. Typically having played mostly Team Deathmatch and Terminal Conquest as I felt Demolition is a little bit underwhelming in this state as you only typically get to use your specials once a game.

For this price. It's worth it. Without a doubt. I got the specialist pack as it seemed the best value for money. The game balance is surprisingly on-point with the fact you have to play it to actually unlock your weapons and there's no real flat advantage to any one item. Gameplay is solid overall.

If you remember Call of Duty 4, this is probably the closest multiplayer experience that goes back to that (played it on Xbox 360 myself) so that's also good. I didn't like them much after that.

If you aren't sold on the concept by now, wait until it's out of Early Access. It'll hopefully be more polished by then.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Going to mention a few things before reviewing. Firstly, the 0.5 hours I managed to play were really fun, but there is obvious signs this game is in Early Access and needs work. Secondly, as a Fan boy to GITS, Im still reviewing this as a game rather than it being linked to the series in anyway or form. EDIT: Go to the bottom for further info, As I have played more without it breaking, I have been able to go in more detail.

Simply put, It's a fun game. Nexon have finally pulled something decent off and im proud im able to play something based of GITS. Nexon in my eyes, have been a poor game company, and the only reason I know about them is from when I tried PC gaming years a go before I even had a PC that could run anything, I lived off Free2Play games, and Nexon generally had the better games at the time (If you weren't a Club Penguin or RuneScape fan).

I was going to be extremely Biased with Nexon making it, but I'm struggling to find any complaints to them as of right now, as the game is fun and they have made it clear that its in Early Access. My first 30 minutes had me watching some superb 3D cutscenes that were beautifully done, and the lip syncing and characters were spot on. you play a Tutorial that takes 10 minutes and you are thrown right into the game to start the Multiplayer side. Now, when I did the Tutorial, everything was Gravy, the game ran at 60FPS on highest no problem, no dips or nothing. the detail and smoothness was incredible, but this changes once you hit the main game. The menu's are pretty Laggy as of right now and suffer slight" drops. none that were a problem so I took it upon myself to ignore that

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A first person shooter that allows you to play all the Section 9 agents from Ghost in the Shell.
The gameplay is solid and the cyberpunk elements blend in well.
You get a selection of classes with unique abilities such as shooting rockets from your arm, deploying exploding drones or turning invisible (or rather somewhat transparent).

In terms of early access it's doing fine as well, the game still lacks features and content to really set it apart from other FPS titles but it runs well without any bigger bugs.

There is ingame monetization, however unlocks come quick even without additional spending and the game does not feel pay2win at all.

Can recommend this game to anyone who's into GitS or just into cyberpunk and shooters in general.
